instructions: Open the iPhone's Settings app, scroll to the Settings screen, and choose Safari. Tap Clear History and Website Data . When prompted to confirm your choice, choose Clear History and Data to delete the log of websites you visited and the cookies stored for the Safari browser. Clearing history and data doesn't change your AutoFill information. While you are in the Safari settings, you can turn on Prevent Cross-Site Tracking and Ask Websites Not to Track . You can also turn on Block All Cookies , but this might prevent some websites from working properly. Close the Settings app when you're done.

Open the iPhone's Settings app and choose Safari . Tap Advanced . In the Advanced settings screen, choose Website Data . The screen that opens lists every website that stored a cookie in the Safari browser app. You can clear all cookies from this screen or select specific cookies to delete. To clear individual cookies from the Website Data screen, swipe left on any website in the list and tap Delete . To delete all the websites in the list, select Remove All Website Data and confirm by tapping Remove Now .

In the Chrome app, tap the ... menu icon in the lower-right corner of the screen. Choose Settings and select Privacy . Tap Clear Browsing Data . Select Cookies, Site Data to enter a check mark and tap Clear Browsing Data . To confirm that you want to clear the Chrome app browsing data, tap Clear Browsing Data .
